column2: (noun) Techniques for reducing sensation and feeling, especailly to control pain
(verb) To make bigger or better by adding to
(adv) In a manner that is officially recognized
(noun) A factor that makes something more difficult or complex
(verb) To set in firmly; to insert in the body surgically
(verb) To insert a liquid by means of a syringe
(noun) A specific way of performing or doing something
(noun) A mark on the skin left after a wound has healed; a lasting sign of damage, either mental or physical
